item.title: HEART: A Unified Benchmark for Assessing Humans and LLMs in Emotional Support Dialogue
item.description: arXiv:2601.19922v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Supportive conversation depends on skills that go beyond language fluency, including reading emotions, adjusting tone, and navigating moments of resistance, frustration, or distress. Despite rapid progress in language models, we still lack a clear way...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, model, alignment, LLM, reasoning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Table-BiEval: A Self-Supervised, Dual-Track Framework for Decoupling Structure and Content in LLM Evaluation
item.description: arXiv:2601.19923v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As Large Language Models (LLMs) evolve into autonomous agents, the capability to faithfully translate natural language into rigorous structured formats-essential for tool invocation-and to convert complex tabular information into machine-readable spec...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, model, LLM, paper, tool | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: ECG-Agent: On-Device Tool-Calling Agent for ECG Multi-Turn Dialogue
item.description: arXiv:2601.20323v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in Multimodal Large Language Models have rapidly expanded to electrocardiograms, focusing on classification, report generation, and single-turn QA tasks. However, these models fall short in real-world scenarios, lacking multi-turn conv...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> experiment, model, LLM, tool, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: MeanCache: From Instantaneous to Average Velocity for Accelerating Flow Matching Inference
item.description: arXiv:2601.19961v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present MeanCache, a training-free caching framework for efficient Flow Matching inference. Existing caching methods reduce redundant computation but typically rely on instantaneous velocity information (e.g., feature caching), which often leads to...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> RAG, experiment, model, vector, image | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context, model, prompt, LLM, tool | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Simulating Complex Multi-Turn Tool Calling Interactions in Stateless Execution Environments
item.description: arXiv:2601.19914v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Synthetic data has proven itself to be a valuable resource for tuning smaller, cost-effective language models to handle the complexities of multi-turn tool calling conversations.
